pageContext.description: Extreme point is midding; the midrib is a tapered continuation of the socket, and is bordered by deep grooves separating it from the bevelled blades, which are corroded.
pageContext.associations: Fragments of other bronze implements were reported to have been found at the same time, but were not preserved by the workmen.
pageContext.publications: Darold E. Dudley, "Early Days in N.W. Linc.", fig. 33, No. 1, pp. 103,"Scunthorpe Museum Publication No. 2, p. 11, fig. 8, No. 1,C.F.C. Hawkes, Archaeological Journal, CIII, p. 7
pageContext.toSearch: Bottesford, Scunthorpe, Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire Dn16, UK
